question: Which of the following figures shows Figure A rotated by 90 degrees clockwise?

options.label: A
options.svg: <svg viewBox="0 0 100 100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><g stroke="black" stroke-width="4" fill="black"><line x1="50" y1="30" x2="50" y2="80"/><line x1="20" y1="30" x2="80" y2="30"/><circle cx="80" cy="30" r="6"/></g></svg>

options.label: B
options.svg: <svg viewBox="0 0 100 100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><g stroke="black" stroke-width="4" fill="black"><line x1="50" y1="30" x2="50" y2="80"/><line x1="20" y1="30" x2="80" y2="30"/><circle cx="20" cy="30" r="6"/></g></svg>

options.label: C
options.svg: <svg viewBox="0 0 100 100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><g stroke="black" stroke-width="4" fill="black"><line x1="20" y1="50" x2="70" y2="50"/><line x1="70" y1="20" x2="70" y2="80"/><circle cx="70" cy="80" r="6"/></g></svg>

options.label: D
options.svg: <svg viewBox="0 0 100 100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><g stroke="black" stroke-width="4" fill="black"><line x1="50" y1="20" x2="50" y2="70"/><line x1="20" y1="70" x2="80" y2="70"/><circle cx="20" cy="70" r="6"/></g></svg>

options.label: E
options.svg: <svg viewBox="0 0 100 100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><g stroke="black" stroke-width="4" fill="black"><line x1="30" y1="50" x2="80" y2="50"/><line x1="30" y1="20" x2="30" y2="80"/><circle cx="30" cy="20" r="6"/></g></svg>

explanation: The task is to rotate Figure A by 90 degrees clockwise. Figure A is an upright 'T' shape with a circle on the end of its right horizontal arm. When rotated 90 degrees clockwise, the vertical stem of the 'T' becomes horizontal and points to the right. The horizontal arm becomes vertical, and the circle, which was on the right, moves to the bottom. Figure C is the only option that shows this correct rotation. Figure B is a reflection, Figure D is a 180-degree rotation, and Figure E is a 90-degree anti-clockwise rotation.

explanation: The figure in option A is a flag with a vertical pole on the left and the triangular flag pointing to the right. A 90-degree clockwise rotation means turning the figure a quarter turn to the right. This causes the vertical pole to become a horizontal pole at the top of the image, and the flag now points downwards. Figure B correctly shows this rotation. Figure C is a 180-degree rotation. Figure D is a 90-degree anti-clockwise rotation. Figure E is a reflection.

explanation: The question requires you to find the pair where the right shape is a 90-degree clockwise rotation of the left shape. In each option, the left shape is an arrow pointing upwards with a circle on its left side. In option A, the arrow on the right correctly points to the right, and the circle is now at the top, which is the result of a 90-degree clockwise turn. Option B shows a 90-degree anti-clockwise rotation. Option C shows a 180-degree rotation. Option D shows a horizontal reflection. Option E shows no rotation at all.

options.label: A
options.svg: <svg viewBox='0 0 100 100'><polyline points='60,70 40,70 40,30' stroke='white' stroke-width='3' fill='none'/><circle cx='40' cy='30' r='6' fill='white'/></svg>

question: Which figure is a 90-degree clockwise rotation of figure A?

options.label: A
options.svg: <svg viewBox="0 0 100 100"><g stroke="black" fill="none" stroke-width="2"><rect x="45" y="20" width="10" height="60"/><rect x="55" y="30" width="20" height="10"/></g></svg>

options.label: B
options.svg: <svg viewBox="0 0 100 100"><g transform="rotate(180 50 50)" stroke="black" fill="none" stroke-width="2"><rect x="45" y="20" width="10" height="60"/><rect x="55" y="30" width="20" height="10"/></g></svg>

options.label: C
options.svg: <svg viewBox="0 0 100 100"><g transform="rotate(90 50 50)" stroke="black" fill="none" stroke-width="2"><rect x="45" y="20" width="10" height="60"/><rect x="55" y="30" width="20" height="10"/></g></svg>

options.label: D

explanation: The question asks for the 90-degree clockwise rotation of figure A. A 90-degree clockwise rotation is equivalent to a quarter turn to the right. When figure A is rotated this way, its long vertical bar becomes horizontal, and the small protruding bar points upwards. Figure C is the only option that correctly depicts this rotation. Figure B is a 180-degree rotation. Figure D is a 90-degree counter-clockwise rotation. Figure E is a horizontal reflection of figure A.

question: Which of the following figures is a 90-degree clockwise rotation of figure A?

options.label: A

options.label: D

options.label: E

explanation: Figure A is a vertical rectangle with a circle attached to its top-right side. A 90-degree clockwise rotation turns the figure a quarter turn to the right. This makes the vertical rectangle horizontal. The circle, which was at the top-right, moves to what becomes the bottom-right of the now horizontal rectangle. Figure C is the only option that shows this correct rotation. Figure B is a 90-degree anti-clockwise rotation. Figure D is a reflection of Figure A. Figure E is an incorrect transformation where the circle has moved to the bottom right of the original vertical shape, not a rotation.

explanation: The question asks for a 90-degree clockwise rotation of Figure A. explanation: The question asks for a 180-degree rotation of the main shape (a letter 'F'). A 180-degree rotation is equivalent to turning the shape upside down. Option B is the only figure that shows the 'F' correctly turned upside down. Option A is a 90-degree clockwise rotation. Option D is a 270-degree clockwise rotation. Option C is a horizontal reflection (a mirror image). Option E is the original shape, un-rotated.

When rotated 90 degrees clockwise, the pole becomes horizontal. The flag moves to what was the top (now the right end) and points downwards. The circle moves to what was the bottom (now the left end). Option C is the only figure that correctly shows this transformation. Option B is a 180-degree rotation, Option D is a 90-degree counter-clockwise rotation, and Option E is a horizontal reflection.

The small triangle, which starts at the top-left, moves to the top-right position. The small circle, which starts at the bottom-right, moves to the bottom-left position. Figure B is the only option that shows this correct rotation. Figure C is a 90-degree anti-clockwise rotation, Figure D is a reflection, and Figure E is a 180-degree rotation.
